Suresh Kumar Sharma, Minister Of Urban Development and Housing Department in Bihar government, shared a poster of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) with an image of a flyover. The poster said that 17,554 streets lights have been installed in Muzaffarpur. “Have worked, will work, we will develop Muzaffarpur. (काम किया है, काम करेंगे, मुजफ्फरपुर का विकास करेंगे |)” – wrote Kumar in the post shared on both Twitter and Facebook.

A simple reverse-image search throws up multiple reports that say the image represents RHS flyover at Bairamalguda junction, Hyderabad inaugurated by Telangana Minister K Taraka Rama Rao (KTR) on August 10, 2020.
KTR had tweeted about the inauguration on August 9 and shared a set of four images including the one in BJP’s poster.
Happy to be throwing open yet another flyover in #Hyderabad tomorrow that has been completed as part of #SRDP (Strategic Road Development Plan)
RHS flyover at Bairamalguda junction, 780 mt long coating 26.5Cr@bonthurammohan @CommissionrGHMC pic.twitter.com/nb0OLqRYvC

A picture of a newly-inaugurated flyover in Hyderabad was shared by Bihar minister Suresh Kumar Sharma as Bihar. In 2018, Ahmedabad Major Bijal Patel had tweeted an image from Seoul as Sabarmati riverfront, Ahmedabad.
Pooja Chaudhuri is a senior editor at Alt News.
